column4: Question: Does anyone know how to change the purple boot splash screen/background?  I've tried ubuntu tweak (which successfully changed the 'login' background, but not the boot splash screen), and I've also tried installing a new Plymouth theme (solar) which successfully changed the screen that comes up when I shutdown, but still doesn't change the initial boot screen purple.
you could replace the image file directly...
I think I tried that as well... how would you do that
Hold on, I'll find the path for you.
going to reboot to try something... be back in 3
back... love how fast :)
SSD is always amazing. :-) I can't seem to remember where the purple background is, though...
yeah... SSD on a shweeet new lenovo x1 carbon
No. GRUB is just a boot manager, not the settings on your OS.
Unless that was the screen you were trying to change?
well.... when I boot up, I first see a black screen with lenovo etc, then a purple blank one, then a purple one with ubuntu text, then login screen.  I want to change two purple ones
I've successfully changed the login screen with ubuntu tweak
I'm not really sure what "Plymouth" is, but I've read a lot about that
drop any image you like into /boot/grub/, and that should change the grub screen too.
tried that and it didn't work
a few other options: http://www.thegeekstuff.com/2012/10/grub-splash-image/
I'm not dual booted, so I don't really care about grub actually... I think boot skips right past it and goes straight to Ubuntu (correct me if I'm wrong)
tried this as well: sudo update-alternatives --config default.plymouth
Well, I'm a lot more useful with grub than with the boot splash, unfortunately. I do wish you luck.
found solution on that page: sudo update-initramfs -k all -u
Awesome. Good on ya. ^_^
